intro: Nealchornea, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while the stems are covered in fine hairs. Nealchornea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
